eu.cqse.check.java

Class ClassNamedExceptionShouldExtendExceptionCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.base.EntityCheckBase
        • eu.cqse.check.java.ClassNamedExceptionShouldExtendExceptionCheck

  • @ACheck(name="Class named like Exception should extend Exception or subclass",
        description="If the name of a class has the suffix *Exception*, one would expect that it inherits from `Exception` or one of its subclasses. Since naming choices like this can cause confusion, occurrences of such unexpected class names will be reported by this check. To avoid false positives, no finding will be created if the name of the parent class contains the term *Exception*.\n\n*Incorrect examples (Java) *\n\n```java\nclass SomeException { } // unexpected, not inheriting from java.lang.Exception or subclass\nclass OtherException extends Foo { } // unexpected, apparently no exception-related parent class\n```\n\n*Correct examples (Java) *\n\n```java\nclass SomeException extends Exception { } \nclass OtherException extends SomeParentException { } \n```\n\n",
        groupName="Bad practice",
        defaultEnablement=YELLOW,
        languages={JAVA,CS},
        parameters=ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE)
public class ClassNamedExceptionShouldExtendExceptionCheck
extends EntityCheckBase
